metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000027 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The Squid Software Foundation Squid HTTP Caching Proxy version prior toversion 4.0.23 contains a NULL Pointer Dereference vulnerability in HTTPResponse X-Forwarded-For header processing that can result in Denial ofService to all clients of the proxy. This attack appear to be exploitablevia Remote HTTP server responding with an X-Forwarded-For header to certaintypes of HTTP request. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in4.0.23 and later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000027` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.5').
